info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 4:22PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Haywood and Swain. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 421 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall due to repeated torrential showers and thunderstorms over the past three hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the past three hours and additional rainfall up to an inch is possible through 530 pm. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain and Smoky Mountains-Big Creek. Flooding is most likely along or near Rough Fork, Palmer Creek, and Cataloochee Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
